document.docAuthor: Demidow, Olga, Kihara, Terue C., Arbizu, Pedro Martínez & Clark, Paul F.
document.masterDocTitle: The megalopal stage of the hydrothermal vent crab Austinograea rodriguezensis Tsuchida & Hashimoto, 2002 (Decapoda: Bythograeidae): a morphological description based on CLSM images

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The megalopal stage of the hydrothermal vent crab Austinograea rodriguezensis Tsuchida & Hashimoto, 2002 (Decapoda: Bythograeidae): a morphological description based on CLSM images

subSubSection.paragraph: Megalopa
Size: SMF 57020 CW 2.8 mm , CL 3.4 mm ; SMF 57021 CW 2.8 mm , CL 3.6 mm .

Carapace ( Fig. 4A–E ): longitudinally rectangular; setation as figured; ventrally directed small, bilobed rostral protrusion; central protrusion between eyes approximately 1/5 to 1/3 distance from frontal margin; anterolateral margin slightly concave with 3 anterolateral teeth, last tooth approximately 2/5 to 1/2 length of carapace from frontal margin; intestinal region slightly depressed.

Antennule ( Figs. 5A ; 7A, B ): peduncle comprising 3 articles with 11,4,4 setae respectively; primary flagellum comprising 4 articles, 1 st unarmed, 2 nd with 6 aesthetascs, 3 rd with 2 simple setae and 7 aesthetascs, 4th with 5 subterminal aesthetascs and 2 (1 subterminal + 1 terminal) long simple setae; accessory flagellum comprising 1 article with 2 subterminal + 3 terminal setae.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 4. CLSM images of
Austinograea rodriguezensis
, megalopa. A. habitus dorsal (SMF 57021); B. habitus ventral (SMF 57021); C–E, cephalothorax without left eye, pleon and pereiopods (SMF 57020); C. dorsal view; D. ventral view; E.

subSubSection.paragraph: lateral view. Scale bars = 0.5 mm .

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 5. CLSM images of
Austinograea rodriguezensis
, megalopa (SMF 57020). A. antennule; B. mandible; C. maxillule without coxal endite; D. maxillule; E. maxilla: coxal and basial endites and endopod; F. maxilla, scaphognathite. Scale bars = 0.1 mm. CLSM images of
Austinograea rodriguezensis
, megalopa A. antenna (SMF 57021); B. fluorescence-labelled phalloidin antennal musculature (SMF 57022); C. detail of annulation on carpus with phalloidin stained musculature (SMF 57022). Scale bars = 100 µm.

FIGURE 6. CLSM images of
Austinograea rodriguezensis
, megalopa A. antenna (SMF 57021); B. fluorescence-labelled phalloidin antennal musculature (SMF 57022); C. detail of annulation on carpus with phalloidin stained musculature (SMF 57022). Scale bars = 100 µm.

FIGURE 7.
Austinograea rodriguezensis
, megalopa. A. antennule with primary and accessory flagellum (SMF 57020); B. antennule, first article of the peduncle (SMF 57020); C. antenna (SMF 570219. Scale bars = 0.1 mm.

FIGURE 8.
Austinograea rodriguezensis
, megalopa (SMF 57020). A. maxillule, missing coxal endite; B. coxal endite of maxillule; C. same appendage as A, basial endite; D. incisive / molar terminal part of the mandible; E. mandibular palp, composed by 3 articles comprising a proximal basis and a 2-articulated endopod. Scale bars = 0.1 mm.

FIGURE 9.
Austinograea rodriguezensis
, megalopa (SMF 57020). A. maxilla, scaphognathite; B. same appendage as A, magnification of plumose setae; C. maxilla, coxal endites, basial endites and endopod. Scale bars = 0.1 mm.

FIGURE 10.
Austinograea rodriguezensis ,
megalopa (SMF 57020). A. second maxilliped; B. coxal endite of first maxilliped, same appendage as D; C. basial endite of first maxilliped, same appendage as D; D. first maxilliped; E. same appendage as D, detail of terminal setae on distal article of exopod. Scale bars = 0.1 mm.

FIGURE 12. CLSM images of
Austinograea rodriguezensis
, megalopa (SMF 57020). A. second maxilliped; B. first maxilliped; C. third maxilliped, arthrobranch gill detached. Scale bars = 0.2 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Pereiopods ( Fig. 13A–K ): uniramous, setation as figured; chela with podobranch and arthrobranch gill; pereiopods 2 and 3 each with podobranch gill, exopod absent.
Sternal plates ( Fig. 4D ): sternites 1 & 2 fused with demarcation between sternites 2 & 3, slight demarcation between sternites 3 & 4.

Pleon ( Fig. 14A; B ): 6 pleomeres present; pleomere 1 with 11 pairs of setae; pleomere 2 with ca. 15 pairs of dorsal and 13 pairs of dorsal marginal setae; pleomere 3 with ca. 13 pairs of dorsal, ca. 11 pairs of dorsal marginal and 4 dorsal medial setae; pleomere 4 (damaged) with ca. 22 pairs of dorsal setae and ca. 1 dorsal medial seta; pleomere 5 with ca. 14 pairs of dorsal, 6 pairs of dorsal marginal and ca. 4 dorsal medial setae; pleomere 6 with ca. 10 dorsal and 4 dorsal marginal setae; pleomeres 1–6 as figured.
